title: rclone crashes if run without any arguments (ie., just `./rclone`)
body:

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

Building rclone from git commit 46b498b86a4ba690707a93369ede32e11ae039c3, and running it with just `./rclone`, it crashes with the below error:

```
‚ûú  ~/dev/rclone git:(test) ./rclone
panic: runtime error: index out of range [1] with length 1

goroutine 1 [running]:
github.com/rclone/rclone/cmd.initConfig()
        /home/janne/dev/rclone/cmd/cmd.go:433 +0x4e9
github.com/spf13/cobra.(*Command).preRun(...)
        /home/janne/go/pkg/mod/github.com/spf13/cobra@v1.8.1/command.go:1019
github.com/spf13/cobra.(*Command).execute(0x42a8960, {0xc0000501b0, 0x0, 0x0})
        /home/janne/go/pkg/mod/github.com/spf13/cobra@v1.8.1/command.go:929 +0x58b
github.com/spf13/cobra.(*Command).ExecuteC(0x42a8960)
        /home/janne/go/pkg/mod/github.com/spf13/cobra@v1.8.1/command.go:1117 +0x3ff
github.com/spf13/cobra.(*Command).Execute(...)
        /home/janne/go/pkg/mod/github.com/spf13/cobra@v1.8.1/command.go:1041
github.com/rclone/rclone/cmd.Main()
        /home/janne/dev/rclone/cmd/cmd.go:541 +0x31
main.main()
        /home/janne/dev/rclone/rclone.go:14 +0xf
```

The crash happens in `cmd/cmd.go`:

```
	// Start the metrics server if configured and not running the "rc" command
	if os.Args[1] != "rc" {
		_, err = rcserver.MetricsStart(ctx, &rc.Opt)
		if err != nil {
			fs.Fatalf(nil, "Failed to start metrics server: %v", err)
		}
	}
```

I think this is a regression caused by commit 7c7606a6cf05eaa368d0c74c24dcd900beca15bc.

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

git commit 46b498b86a4ba690707a93369ede32e11ae039c3

```
clone version
rclone v1.60.1-DEV
- os/version: ubuntu 24.04 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 6.8.0-52-generic (x86_64)
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.22.2
- go/linking: dynamic
- go/tags: none
```


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)

Ubuntu 22, 64-bit.

#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)

Happens on all backends.

#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

`./rclone`

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

Doesn't happen with `-vv`.
